description: A podcast about living freely in a world given back to us

items.content:
01:45 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	02:20 - Main Topic (Jeremiah 2)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY-FIVE, Mike, Jason, and Wade discuss Jeremiah 2. The picture doesn't really match the episode theme, but it will make sense if you listen. We hope you enjoy the episode!


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer. You can find them all on Apple Podcasts. You can support the network here. You support is greatly appreciated and helps the network continue to produce and provide this content for free for a world in desperate need of good news and true freedom. 
More 1517 content can also be found on YouTube. 
What’s New from 1517?
Giving Tuesday
1517 will be participating with a goal to raise $200,000 and we hope you will join us. Every single gift we receive that day will go towards projects like this one AND will be 100% matched! Your support makes these resources and this very show possible – we are completely funded by listeners. Please consider supporting here. 
Freedom Lessons
What do seminary professors, Luther’s Small Catechism, and Hip Hop have in common? With a surprising blend of contributors, 1517 Music proudly presents "Freedom Lessons," its latest musical creation. "Freedom Lessons" delves into the core teachings of Luther's Small Catechism through the medium of music, offering a fresh and innovative way to convey the Reformation's enduring truths. This album is a testament to 1517 Music's commitment to conveying the profound truths of the Reformation in a creative and captivating manner.
This record explores the chief parts of Luther’s Small Catechism through music. It features performances by Flame, LOSO, and many other highly talented musicians. Find the full album and learn more here.


More from the hosts
Michael Berg 
Wade Johnston
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!
Attributions for Music and Image used in this Episode: 


 	

 	“The Last One” by Jahzzar is licensed under an Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 International License.
 	“Gib laut” by Dirk Becker is licensed under an Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives (aka Music Sharing) 3.0 International License.
 	“Whistling Down the Road” by Silent Partner.
 	“Not Drunk” by The Joy Drops is licensed under an Attribution 4.0 International License.

items.content:
01:45 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	06:15 - Main Topic (Salem Witch Trials)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY-FOUR, Wade and Jason discuss the Salem Witch Trial with Dr. Aaron Palmer, Wade's colleague in the history department and our school chair. We hope you enjoy the episode!


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer. You can find them all on Apple Podcasts. You can support the network here. You support is greatly appreciated and helps the network continue to produce and provide this content for free for a world in desperate need of good news and true freedom. 
More 1517 content can also be found on YouTube. 
What’s New from 1517?
Giving Tuesday
We are only a couple weeks away from a very important day for 1517. We’re coming up on Giving Tuesday! People worldwide celebrate Giving Tuesday by donating to their favorite nonprofit organizations. I imagine you may already know about it, or have received info from some of the nonprofits you’re connected with.
1517 will be participating with a goal to raise $200,000 and we hope you will join us. Every single gift we receive that day will go towards projects like this one AND will be 100% matched!
   If you answered “Yes,” to any or all of these questions, please join us on Giving Tuesday! Your support makes these resources and this very show possible – we are completely funded by listeners. Please consider supporting here. 
Freedom Lessons
What do seminary professors, Luther’s Small Catechism, and Hip Hop have in common? With a surprising blend of contributors, 1517 Music proudly presents "Freedom Lessons," its latest musical creation. "Freedom Lessons" delves into the core teachings of Luther's Small Catechism through the medium of music, offering a fresh and innovative way to convey the Reformation's enduring truths. This album is a testament to 1517 Music's commitment to conveying the profound truths of the Reformation in a creative and captivating manner.
This record explores the chief parts of Luther’s Small Catechism through music. It features performances by Flame, LOSO, and many other highly talented musicians. Find the full album and learn more here.
Your God is too Glorious, 2nd Edition
 Your God Is Too Glorious reminds readers that while a quiet life may look unimpressive to the world, it's the regular, everyday people that God tends to use to do his most important work. In this second edition of the book, you will now find discussion questions at the end of each chapter to help facilitate discussion. You can get your copy here. 

More from the hosts
Michael Berg 
Wade Johnston
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

items.title: Episode 253: Ezekiel 16 (Rated R according to Mike)

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	09:05 - Free-for-All (Novelty T-Shirts)
 	23:45 - Main Topic (Luther's Flood Prayer)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY-TWO, Mike, Wade and Matt Scharf from Grace Lutheran in downtown Milwaukee discussed Luther's Flood Prayer, often used for the Sacrament of Holy Baptism. We thank Matt for joining us. We are sorry Jason bailed on this episode. Sometimes he just disappears when there is work to be done. We hope you enjoy the episode!


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer. You can find them all on Apple Podcasts. You can support the network here. You support is greatly appreciated and helps the network continue to produce and provide this content for free for a world in desperate need of good news and true freedom. 
More 1517 content can also be found on YouTube. 
What’s New from 1517:
Join the 1517 Academy
Freedom Lessons Street Team

Tune in Oct. 26 – Oct. 28th for 1517’s 2023 annual national conference -- C.S. Lewis & the Untamed God. It's sold out, but you can still join it through the FREE hosted livestream. For the first time ever, we will be hosting the HWSS livestream, with exclusive interviews and experiences only available on the livestream. Tune in to this free three-day conference and rest in your forgiveness with us.
FREE 2023 Advent Resources: God was the first tailor, seamstress, and cobbler. He covered Adam and Eve’s shame and nakedness with garments of animal skin. He designed and instructed the Israelites on the priestly wardrobe of the Tabernacle. And now he clothes his children in the righteousness of Jesus, our King, who first came to us wrapped in swaddling clothes before he hung naked on the cross. This Advent season, 1517 presents The Clothing of the King: a new free resource for churches that walks your congregation through the divine wardrobe God provides for his people. This all-in-one package includes a midweek Advent and Christmas Sermon Series for pastors to use in their congregations as well as music helps, original and suggested hymns, presenter slides, and more. We’ve also created a personal devotional for every day of the 2023 Advent Season, written by 1517 contributors. The Clothing of the King is available as a free download. Sign up today to get access.
NWA Tickets are Now Available! Tickets are now on sale for the 2024 Here We Still Stand Regional Conference in Northwest Arkansas! Join 1517 May 3rd and 4th as they gather again at the iconic Meteor Theater in Bentonville, Arkansas, and celebrate the boundless grace of God in the gospel of Jesus. The 2024 theme will be “Grace and Peace in Christ” – get your tickets today.


All Charges Dropped, Vol. 2. Dive into the pages of the second volume of All Charges Dropped, where the author Haroldo Camacho, a Certified Court Interpreter, invites you into the gripping world of courtrooms. These real-life narratives pull you into the heart of divorce cases, murder trials, and more, making you feel like you're right there in the audience. But these stories also lead you to something deeper—the ultimate courtroom of God's judgment seat. Through each tale, you'll find a common thread: "Your sins are forgiven." As you journey through these stories, you'll witness a shift from human justice to divine grace, where guilt is replaced by freedom and forgiveness reigns supreme. You can find the book here.
A New Series from the Thinking Fellows – The Four Solas of the Reformation. This month, the Thinking Fellows Podcast is doing a four-episode series explaining the phrases grace alone, faith alone, Christ alone, and scripture alone. Many of the central teachings of Reformation theology are summed up in these “Sola” phrases. Listen in to hear about the history and use of the Solas in Lutheran theology and why they rem...

Tune in Oct. 26 – Oct. 28th for 1517’s 2023 annual national conference -- C.S. Lewis & the Untamed God. It's sold out, but you can still join it through the FREE hosted livestream. For the first time ever, we will be hosting the HWSS livestream, with exclusive interviews and experiences only available on the livestream. Tune in to this free three-day conference and rest in your forgiveness with us.
FREE 2023 Advent Resources: God was the first tailor, seamstress, and cobbler. He covered Adam and Eve’s shame and nakedness with garments of animal skin. He designed and instructed the Israelites on the priestly wardrobe of the Tabernacle. And now he clothes his children in the righteousness of Jesus, our King, who first came to us wrapped in swaddling clothes before he hung naked on the cross. This Advent season, 1517 presents The Clothing of the King: a new free resource for churches that walks your congregation through the divine wardrobe God provides for his people. This all-in-one package includes a midweek Advent and Christmas Sermon Series for pastors to use in their congregations as well as music helps, original and suggested hymns, presenter slides, and more. We’ve also created a personal devotional for every day of the 2023 Advent Season, written by 1517 contributors. The Clothing of the King is available as a free download. Sign up today to get access.
NWA Tickets are Now Available! Tickets are now on sale for the 2024 Here We Still Stand Regional Conference in Northwest Arkansas! Join 1517 May 3rd and 4th as they gather again at the iconic Meteor Theater in Bentonville, Arkansas, and celebrate the boundless grace of God in the gospel of Jesus. The 2024 theme will be “Grace and Peace in Christ” – get your tickets today.


All Charges Dropped, Vol. 2. Dive into the pages of the second volume of All Charges Dropped, where the author Haroldo Camacho, a Certified Court Interpreter, invites you into the gripping world of courtrooms. These real-life narratives pull you into the heart of divorce cases, murder trials, and more, making you feel like you're right there in the audience. But these stories also lead you to something deeper—the ultimate courtroom of God's judgment seat. Through each tale, you'll find a common thread: "Your sins are forgiven." As you journey through these stories, you'll witness a shift from human justice to divine grace, where guilt is replaced by freedom and forgiveness reigns supreme. You can find the book here.
A New Series from the Thinking Fellows – The Four Solas of the Reformation. This month, the Thinking Fellows Podcast is doing a four-episode series explaining the phrases grace alone, faith alone, Christ alone, and scripture alone. Many of the central teachings of Reformation theology are summed up in these “Sola” phrases. Listen in to hear about the history and use of the Solas in Lutheran theology and why they rem...

* 00:00 - Introduction
* 09:05 - Free-for-All (Novelty T-Shirts)
* 23:45 - Main Topic (Luther's Flood Prayer)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY-TWO, Mike, Wade and Matt Scharf from Grace Lutheran in downtown Milwaukee discussed Luther's Flood Prayer, often used for the Sacrament of Holy Baptism. We thank Matt for joining us. We are sorry Jason bailed on this episode. Sometimes he just disappears when there is work to be done. We hope you enjoy the episode!

00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	04:00 - Main Topic (You and Your Bible)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY (!), Wade, Mike, and Jason recorded live at WLC for the Milwaukee area campus ministry, The Point of Grace. This episode focused on you and your Bible--what are you supposed to do with that thing? Thanks for all the students who joined us! We enjoyed the fellowship and the great discussion before and after. We hope you enjoy the episode!


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. Thanks for listening!

items.title: Episode 249: Theology as Habitus Practicus

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	6:10 - Main Topic (Doctrine, Not Doctrines)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FORTY-EIGHT, Wade, Mike, and Jason discuss doctrine (as opposed to doctrines) and how the Bible is a book about Christ and not a collection of proof texts. We hope you enjoy the episode!



We would like to thank our listeners for partnering with us during our annual Podcast Fundraiser. items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)

items.content:
In the EIGHTH session of our series on Jason and Wade's Germany travel, we continue our overview of the May 2024 trip, walking through days 9 through 11. We hope you enjoy the episode. 

If this series gives you an itch to travel, you can learn about the trip to Germany that Jason and Wade are leading in May 2024 here. We'd love to have you join us.  

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. items.title: Wingin' It 239.1: Germany 2024 - Days 9-11 (Wittenberg and Berlin)

items.content:
In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTY-NINE, Mike, Wade, Dan Berg, who may or many not be related to Michael, and Tom Jeske discuss Luther's catechisms, catechesis, and the family altar. We hope you enjoy the episode! If you'd like to catch some of Dan's catechetical videos, you can find him on Instagram and YouTube @revdanberg. You can learn more about his church on Facebook (oursaviorharrisonville). You can learn more about Tom's church at livinghopeomaha.com.


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer. You can find them all on Apple Podcasts. items.content:
In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTY-SEVEN, Mike, Wade, and Greg discuss despair, disenchantment, acedia, and other despair-related things. This is the third part of a three-part series on death, disappointment, and despair. While the topic sounds morbid, we pray you find the episodes encouraging. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. While the topic sounds morbid, we pray you find the episodes encouraging. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer. You can find them all on Apple Podcasts. You can support the network here. You support is greatly appreciated and helps the network continue to produce and provide this content for free for a world in desperate need of good news and true freedom.
More 1517 content can also be found on YouTube. For some new publications from 1517, consider The New Quest for Paul and His Reading of the Old Testament by Timo Laato or Finding God in the Darkness: Hopeful Reflections from the Pits of Depression, Despair, and Disappointment by Bradley Gray.

items.title: Episode 235: Death, The Great Enemy of Life

items.content:
In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTY-FOUR, Mike and Wade discuss human flourishing and the economy of God's love. What is human flourishing? How does it relate to the Word? How does it relate to this world? What does it teach us about our relationship with God and neighbor, and how God deals with us and our neighbor? What is the economy of God's love? What is its significance? We hope you enjoy the episode! 


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. items.title: Wingin' It 233.1: Germany 2024 - Days 4-5 (Nuremburg, Coburg, Erfurt)

items.content:
In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTY-THREE, Mike and Wade discuss Sunday, the sabbath, worship, and feasts. Why do Christians historically gather on Sundays? What happened to Saturday? What does sabbath mean? What does God want for us regarding it? What's the point of the divine service on Sunday? When/where do we worship? Why does God love feasts, and why should we? We hope you enjoy the episode! 


Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer. You can find them all on Apple Podcasts. You support is greatly appreciated and helps the network continue to produce and provide this content for free for a world in desperate need of good news and true freedom. If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTY-TWO, Mike and Wade discuss Pentecost and Holy Trinity Sunday. What's the significance of these two days in the church year? Why is Pentecost such an important event in church history. What does it mean today?  We hope you enjoy the episode!

items.title: Wingin' It 231.1: Germany Travel – Church History and Theology

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	8:15 - Main Topic (Systems, Faces, and Vocations)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THIRTY-ONE, Mike, Jason, and Wade discuss systems, faces, and vocations. It's easy to get caught up in causes, in sweeping programs, in grand schemes, but Christ calls us to love our neighbor right where we find him or her. How do we balance political involvement and policy concerns with daily life and real people. Drawing on a scened from the Grand Inquisitor section of the Brothers Karamazov by Dostoevsky, we talk about the importance of loving people with faces, concretely, in the vocations God gives us, when and where we find them, through the freedom of the gospel, rather than being paralyzed, consumed, or distracted by the abstract. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

itunes.summary:
In the SEVENTH session of our series on Jason and Wade's recent trip to Rome, we talk about our last days in Italy and our brief stay in Munich. We hope you enjoy this session and series as much as we enjoyed the limoncello! Pour some out for the People's Hat. 

If this series gives you an itch to travel, you can learn about the trip to Germany that Jason and Wade are leading in May 2024 here. We'd love to have you join us.

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	06:30 - Free-for-All (Is It Rude to Make Eye Contact, Smile, and Wave at People)
 	18:00 - Main Topic (The Bennett Law and Language)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND TWENTY-EIGHT, Mike, Jason, and Wade continue to discuss the Bennett Law, when confessional Lutherans teamed up with the Roman Catholics in Wisconsin to vote out the Republicans over the use of English in schools. Wade recently presented on the topic for the Milwaukee County Historical Society and we thought it could make a fun episode or two. We hope you enjoy it! 


We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 228: The Bennett Law, Lutherans and Politics

items.content:
In the SIXTH session of our series on Jason and Wade's recent trip to Rome, we talk about our sixth day in Italy and discuss the development of feast days and the cult of the saints. We hope you enjoy this session and series. 

If this series gives you an itch to travel, you can learn about the trip to Germany that Jason and Wade are leading in May 2024 here. We'd love to have you join us.

 	9:00 - Main Topic (Drunk Noah and God's Messy Saints)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND TWENTY-SIX, Mike, Jason, Wade, and Mark Braun continue the guys' discussion of anthropology, now talking about Noah's drunkenness, why Moses would include that in Genesis, and the messy nature of the Christian past.  We hope you enjoy the episode! 


We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 222: Beisbol and Bilingual Ministry in Milwaukee with Chad Walta

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	7:25 - Main Topic (And He Died)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND TWENTY-ONE, Mike, Jason, Wade, and Tyler continue the guys' discussion of anthropology. They discuss what it means that Adam's son, Seth, and all after him, are made in Adam's image and likeness, the "and he died" refrain of chapter five, human corruption, the Nephilim, and our temptation to externalize sin and internalize salvation, among other things. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	7:40 - Main Topic (Life after Murder)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND TWENTY, Jason, Wade and Mark continue the guys' discussion of anthropology. Our focus this time around is life in the world after the first murder, where power and status became a driving force. We were very excited that Mark Braun was able to join us. We hope you enjoy the episode!

items.title: Episode 220: Life after Murder (Genesis 4 with Mark Braun), Anthropology, Part 7

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	10:35 - Main Topic (The Guys Do a True Crime Podcast)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND NINETEEN, Mike, Jason, and Wade continue the guys' discussion of anthropology. Our focus this time around is the first murder, as Cain kills his brother Abel in a rage over sacrifice and God's favor. We were very excited and are very grateful that Pastor Noah Bater of Prince of Peace Lutheran in Thousand Oaks, California was able to join us. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 219: The Guys Do a True Crime Podcast (Genesis 4), Anthropology, Part 6

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	21:30 - Main Topic (Ministry Talk with James Metsger)

Wade has friends, or at least a friend! In this episode we prove it. In episode TWO HUNDRED AND EIGHTEEN, Jason and Wade talk to Pastor James Metsger of Christ Point in Charlotte, North Carolina, one of Wade's best friends since high school. This was our first attempt at hosting a remote guest with the new equipment, and Wade was thrilled and grateful that James was able to be that first guest. While they took different paths and serve in different denominations (Wade is Lutheran and James is not Lutheran, and lets Wade refer to him as a Baptist for purposes of the episode, and because he knows from decades of experience that Wade is going to say what he wants no matter what), they both found their way into ministry. After years of talking about recording something, they finally did, and talked about their experiences and lessons learned since their days together in their youth. Jason adds perspective from his ministry as well, and gets to bond with James under the cross of friendship with Wade. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 218: Ministry Talk with James Metsger (Wade Has Friends!)

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	9:30 - Main Topic (Promise and Curses: Genesis 3)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND SEVENTEEN, Mike, Jason, and Wade continue the guys' discussion of anthropology. We focus especially upon the relationship between God's promise and the curses at the end of Genesis 3 and how the gospel predominates, even in this darkest moment in mankind's history, the fall into sin, when death came into the world. They also test out new equipment, which we got a while ago, but Wade just now finally figured out. We hope it improves the sound of the podcast and it will make having guests on remotely way easier, so get ready for some fun guests. We had a guest or two lined up this week, but the weather put an end to that. Please feel free to email the weather to complain. As you'll notice, we can now incorporate sound effects, too, which Wade maybe enjoys too much. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

Thanks for listening!

items.title: Episode 217: Promise and Curses, Anthropology, Part 5 (Genesis 3)

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	08:55 - Free-for-All (Raleigh Sadler and MercyCast)
 	23:50 - Main Topic (Anthropology: Genesis 3)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND SIXTEEN, Mike, Jason, Peter (yes, Peter!), Nate Wordell, Raleigh Sadler and Wade continue the guys' discussion of anthropology. Raleigh Sadler, on campus to speak for our students (until an attack of snow struck) joins us and tells us about his work with Let My People Go, his book, Vulnerable, and his new podcast, MercyCast. As we explore Genesis 3, we discuss how human beings have striven to understand who they are across time (we are not machines or computers, for instance) and hit on loneliness and human connection, fallenness and vulnerability. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	21:30 - Main Topic (James Arne Nestingen, "Justification by Faith in Luther’s Small Catechism")

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND TWELVE, Mike and Wade are give thanks for the life and ministry of Jim Nestingen and discuss his article entitled "Justification by Faith in Luther's Small Catechism" from Logia 16-4. We encourage you to check out some of Jim's lectures on YouTube. Here is a good one with which to start. We also mentioned the Festschrift published in honor of Jim's life and work by 1517. It is well worth your time, too. We hope you enjoy the episode!

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	04:15 - Free-for-All (Jasondale Christmas & College FB Playoff Mascot Battles)
 	21:30 - Main Topic (Hermeneutics)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND ELEVEN, Mike, Jason, and Wade are joined by both campus ministry pastors again to talk hermeneutics (how to read the Scriptures). For this episode we have three big questions to address regarding hermeneutics. We hope to follow up more on the topic later as well, eventually delving into Matthias Flacius' rules for interpreting the Sacred Scriptures. For the free-for-all, we have two topics: first, Jasondale Christmas traditions, and second, college football playoff mascot battles. We hope you enjoy the episode! 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

Thanks for listening!

items.title: Episode 208: Ethics as Formation (with Special Guests!)

WORK_OF_ART: A Little Exercise for Young Theologians

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	15:20 - Main Topic (Theology, Philosophy, and Bonhoeffer's Ethics)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND SEVEN, Jason and Wade discuss theology and philosophy in the light of the first chapter Dietrich Bonhoeffer's Ethics and how neither can address the whole person apart from the incarnate Christ, who is the reality behind both the church and the world, so that the Christian can no more retreat from the world than the unbeliever can be whole apart from Christ. We hope this will be the first of several episodes down the road. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

 	“Whistling Down the Road” by Silent Partner.

 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	1o:30 - Main Topic (The Book Draft)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FIVE, Mike, Wade, and Jason continue to help you populate your bookshelves. In Episode 199, Wade and Jason had discusses three books, or maybe four, that everyone should have on their bookshelves. Building on that, now they conduct a draft to add more books to the shelves. We would link them here, but Wade is too lazy. Perhaps we need to get him a motivational book. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	5:10 - Main Topic (The Self)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND FOUR, Mike, Wade, and Jason discuss the self and our notions of it, using Andrea Wulf's article in the Atlantic, "Where Our Sense of Self Comes From," as a springboard. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

 	Google Play

You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	11:20 - Main Topic (A Little Exercise for Young Theologians, Part 2)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND THREE, Mike, Wade, and Jason continue their discussion of Helmut Thielicke's A Little Exercise for Young Theologians. The guys think the book is worth reading, not only for young theologians, but all theologians, laity and the ordained. We went a bit long with the intro, but had fun. Feel free to skip ahead to the episode, though, if you'd like. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	06:15 - Main Topic (The Guys Dig Francis' New Apostolic Letter)

In episode TWO HUNDRED AND ONE, Wade and Mike continue our discussion regarding recent debates about the Roman Mass between advocates for the TLM (Traditional/Tridentine Latin Mass) and the Novus Ordo (the Roman Mass in the vernacular after Vatican II). They begin to delve deeper into some of the recent writings issued and measures taken by Pope Francis in this regard, and they like them more than you might expect, especially Francis' recent apostolic letter on the liturgy (Desiderio desideravi). We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

items.title: Episode 201: The Guys Dig Francis' New Apostolic Letter (Novus Ordo or TLM, Part 2)

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	16:10 - Main Topic (Novus Ordo or TLM, Roman Catholic Worship Wars)

In episode TWO HUNDRED, Wade and Mike discuss recent debates about the Roman Mass between advocates for the TLM (Traditional/Tridentine Latin Mass) and the Novus Ordo (the Roman Mass after Vatican II). We begin to delve into some of the recent writings issued and measures taken by Pope Francis in this regard, but will really get into the pertinent documents more in the follow-up episode. So, what's up with the fight about Roman Masses, TLM or Novus Ordo? Why should Lutherans care about it? What can we learn from it? What's the history? Should Luther be blamed for it all? What does it say about the relationship between religion and culture? Should the boomers be blamed for it all? We get into this and other topics as we try to make sense of things. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-NINE, Wade and Jason discuss the books we'd like to see everyone own and why. While our recommendations come from a Lutheran perspective, we try to make applications for Christians as a whole. We hope you enjoy the episode!

00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	06:50 - Main Topic (Hymns, and What Makes One Good?)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-EIGHT, Wade and Jason discuss the hymns. What's their history? Why has the Christian Church produced so many? What's their place in the divine service and the Christian's daily life? What makes one good or bad? How do music and the text relate? We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	12:40 - Free-for-All (MLB Trade Deadline: Buyers or Sellers?)
 	23:50 - Main Topic (Why Ministry?)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-SEVEN, Wade and Jason are joined by Pastors Greg Lyon (WLC) and Collin Vanderhoof (Pilgrim Lutheran, Menomonee Falls) to discuss the ministry, especially why they went into it and what keeps them in it, despite the challenges. We really enjoyed this one and are hoping we can get Greg and Collin back on soon to keep the discussion going. We are releasing it early because we discussed the MLB trade deadline (today) for the free-for-all and whether our teams (Brewers, Twins, Tigers, and Cubs) were buyers or sellers, and what we thought of the action so far. If you don't care about baseball, remember that the time stamps are above, so you can skip right to the main topic. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-FOUR, Wade, Mike, and Jason (the gang is back in town!) discuss God. Who is He? Who isn't He? What are misconceptions about Him? What do we know about Him, and how? These and other questions lead to some fruitful conversation. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-FOUR, Wade, Mike, and Jason (the gang is back in town!) discuss God. Who is He? Who isn't He? What are misconceptions about Him? What do we know about Him, and how? These and other questions lead to some fruitful conversation. We hope you enjoy the episode!

items.title: Episode 191: Everyone's a Theologian

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	08:30 - Main Topic (The Pastor's Office)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY, Mike and Wade discuss the pastor's office, or study, the space where he meets with people, counsels, absolves, prays, reflects, learns, and prepares for the divine service and his sermon. In the process, they share thoughts on how pastors and congregations can help make them as conducive as possible to all that happens there. We hope you enjoy the episode!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 190: The Pastor's Office

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
 	08:30 - Main Topic (The Lord's Supper: A Thesis)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-NINE, Mike and Wade get feisty. They've been doing this podcast for a long time now, and they figure they've earned the right to be a little blunt. Without letting Mike know beforehand, Wade chose the topic for the episode, knowing it would lead to vigorous discussion. Wade introduces a simple thesis: The Lord's Supper is the very body and blood of Christ, given for the forgiveness of sins, life, and salvation. If that thesis is true, what does that mean for Christian theology, the Christian life, the divine service, piety, etc.? Once Wade winds Mike up, they give the topic a good go. There's a lot more to discuss here, but this is what came to mind first. We hope you enjoy the conversation! If the guys get you worked up, too, maybe that's not a bad thing. It's an opportunity to step back and ask why that is. Maybe it's because the guys were feisty and talking nonsense, but maybe not...? 

Oh, John wanders in halfway through the episode, because he was the worship coordinator for the district convention held at the college. After a few minutes, it was pretty clear he realized the guys were worked up. Kudos him for handling things so pastorally at the end when Wade insisted he jump on a mic before things wrapped up. 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

 	“Whistling Down the Road” by Silent Partner.
 	“Not Drunk” by The Joy Drops is licensed under an Attribution 4.0 International License.

itunes.subtitle: 00:00 - Introduction   00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)   08:30 - Main Topic (The Lord's Supper: A Thesis) - In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-NINE, Mike and Wade get feisty. They've been doing this podcast for a long time now,
itunes.summary:
* 00:00 - Introduction
* 00:00 - Free-for-All (No Free-for-All)
* 08:30 - Main Topic (The Lord's Supper: A Thesis)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-NINE, Mike and Wade get feisty. They've been doing this podcast for a long time now, and they figure they've earned the right to be a little blunt. Without letting Mike know beforehand, Wade chose the topic for the episode, knowing it would lead to vigorous discussion. Wade introduces a simple thesis: The Lord's Supper is the very body and blood of Christ, given for the forgiveness of sins, life, and salvation. If that thesis is true, what does that mean for Christian theology, the Christian life, the divine service, piety, etc.? Once Wade winds Mike up, they give the topic a good go. There's a lot more to discuss here, but this is what came to mind first. We hope you enjoy the conversation! If the guys get you worked up, too, maybe that's not a bad thing. It's an opportunity to step back and ask why that is. Maybe it's because the guys were feisty and talking nonsense, but maybe not...? 

Oh, John wanders in halfway through the episode, because he was the worship coordinator for the district convention held at the college. After a few minutes, it was pretty clear he realized the guys were worked up. Kudos him for handling things so pastorally at the end when Wade insisted he jump on a mic before things wrapped up. 


We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 189: The Guys Get Feisty: The Lord's Supper: A Thesis

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	13:30 - Free-for-All (What Saint Would You Name a Church After?)
 	29:00 - Main Topic (Why All the Other Stuff Matters)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-EIGHT, Mike and Wade discuss why the liturgy, church architecture, music, art, etc. all matter so much, especially when preaching in general is not so great. For the free-for-all, we discuss what saint we'd name a church after if we were starting a new church. You get some serious answers and some less serious. We hope you enjoy the conversation!

items.title: Episode 188: When the Sermons Aren't Good (Why All the Other Stuff Matters)

items.content:
In the SIXTY-SIXTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike wrap things up. This series started in December of 2018. It has been quite the undertaking, but very beneficial for both of the guys as they've worked through everything. Even if you've not listened to the series so far, the finale is worth checking out, as they discuss why Luther matters, his place today, what his lasting contributions to the church have been, and the dangers of trying to "play Luther," among other things We hope you enjoy the session and, if you haven't, maybe check out the series. There is one "earmuffs" moment, but Wade gives ample warning beforehand, so don't blame him if you hear a colorful word. If you need to blame someone, blame Jason for not being there to keep order. 

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

 	“Not Drunk” by The Joy Drops is licensed under an Attribution 4.0 International License.

items.title: Wingin' It 187.1: Life after Luther (Part 66) – The Luther Series Finale!

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	12:00 - Free-for-All (Lutheran Stuff Lutherans Say Is Too "Catholic")
 	24:30 - Main Topic (The Guys Get Catholic)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-SEVEN, Mike, Wade, and Jason (enjoy him here, because he's off to travel the world and won't be with us for a while) discuss catholicity and why Lutherans are at their best when they are their most catholic (for instance, with the Augsburg Confession). The guys discuss how we should be catholic in liturgy, music, art, history, and other ways, if we want to be truly Lutheran as the reformers conceived of their theology and mission. We hope you enjoy the conversation!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 187: The Guys Get Catholic

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	00:00 - No Free-for-All
 	05:50 - Main Topic (Uniquely Stupid, and the Importance of Community and Formation)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-SIX, Mike and Wade discuss an article in the Atlantic by Jonathan Haidt, which leads to a discussion of the importance and community and formation, and why the Lutheran Church, and Christian Church in general, is in dire need of a rediscovery of both. This turned into a really helpful conversation for the two of us and may lead to a few more episodes. We hope you enjoy the conversation!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.content:
In the SIXTY-FIFTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike continue a new mini-series in the Life of Luther series: Life after Luther. In this session they discuss the Flacian controversy over original sin and why the doctrine of original sin is so important. As an outline, we are using Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

In the SIXTY-FIFTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike continue a new mini-series in the Life of Luther series: Life after Luther. In this session they discuss the Flacian controversy over original sin and why the doctrine of original sin is so important. As an outline, we are using Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

You can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

items.title: Episode 185: Romans 13 (Church and State)

items.content:
In the SIXTY-FOURTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike continue a new mini-series in the Life of Luther series: Life after Luther. In this session they discuss the Synergistic Controversy over free will, and whether we have it in matters of salvation. As an outline, we are using Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

In the SIXTY-THIRD session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike continue a new mini-series in the Life of Luther series: Life after Luther. In this session they discuss the Osiandrian Controversy over the doctrine of justification. As an outline, we are using Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

items.title: Episode 183: Holy Week

items.content:
In the SIXTY-SECOND session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike continue a new mini-series in the Life of Luther series: Life after Luther. In this session they discuss the Majoristic Controversy over the proposition that good works are necessary for salvation. As an outline, we are using Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

itunes.summary:
In the SIXTY-SECOND session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike continue a new mini-series in the Life of Luther series: Life after Luther. In this session they discuss the Majoristic Controversy over the proposition that good works are necessary for salvation. As an outline, we are using Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

items.title: Episode 182: The Means of Grace

items.content:
In the SIXTY-FIRST session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike, begin to wrap stuff up with a new mini-series, Life after Luther. In this session they provide the framework for a broader discussion of the controversies that broke out after Luther's death, which were addressed in the Formula of Concord, the final Lutheran confession of the Book of Concord (the book containing the Lutheran Confessions). As an outline, they use Wade's book, An Uncompromising Gospel, which will help guide discussion in the weeks to come. If you'd like to follow along in the book, you can find it here or here.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

items.title: Wingin' It 181.1: Life after Luther (Part 61) – Fault Lines Crack (An Uncompromising Gospel)

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	0:00 - Free for All (No Free for All)
 	13:00 - Main Topic (Why Genesis?)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY-ONE, Wade and Jason (Mike should know better by now than to leave us unattended) discuss Genesis. Why was it written? Why has the Christian Church emphasized it? Why is it harder to get around its content than we might think? Why is it such a fruitful book for study still today, for knowing God, our neighbor, our world, and our selves better? We hope you enjoy the conversation!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Wingin' It 180.1: The Life of Luther (Part 60) – Katie and the Kids after Luther's Death

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	0:00 - Free for All (No Free for All)
 	3:10 - Main Topic (What about the Saints?)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND EIGHTY, Wade and Mike (who knows what that new guy, whatever his name is, was doing this time) discuss the Saints (as in the Roman Catholic kind) and what the Augsburg Confession and the Apology have to say about them. They also discuss the place of the commemoration of saints in the church calendar, why we commemorate them (and should) in the Lutheran Church, and what we can learn from our fathers and mothers in the faith. We hope you enjoy the conversation!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 180: What about the Saints?

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	8:25 - Free for All (MLB Predictions)
 	20:55 - Main Topic (Why Church History?)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-NINE, Wade and Mike (the new guy was on vacation...again) discuss why church history matters, not just for professors or pastors, but for every Christian. Mike and Wade also talked some baseball to start things out, making some predictions for 2022. Jason didn't try opening or closing the episode, because, well, he'd have to show up for that. items.title: Episode 179: Why Church History?

items.content:
In the FIFTY-NINTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike discuss Luther's early and late writings and statements on the Jews and Turks. We hope you find the discussion worthwhile.

items.title: Wingin' It 176.1: The Life of Luther (Part 56) – Calvin

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	7:00 - Free for All (Favorite Things about Lent)
 	28:00 - Main Topic (Why a Lutheran College Like WLC?)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-SIX, Wade, Jason, and Greg discuss the place and role of a college like WLC in higher ed. With so many schools out there, what need is there for one such as ours? Greg brings his perspective as a campus pastor for seven years now, Jason provides the fresh voice of a n00b, and Wade speaks from eight years of experience teaching theology, history, and philosophy.  As you can probably tell from the length of the episode, Mike couldn't join us, and things got a little out of hand. Along the way, we also manage to talk Lent, druthers, Jason's dashing fashion as of late, Moroccan vanilla, whiskey barrels, and autographed canoe paddles. We really enjoyed the discussion, and we hope you do, too!


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!

items.title: Episode 176: Why A Lutheran College like WLC? Also, Some Lent Talk, Druthers, and Jason's Dashing Fashion

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	5:45 - Free for All (Best and Worst Things We've Rigged)
 	16:15 - Main Topic (Christian Funerals)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-FIVE, Wade and Mike, and Jason, discuss funerals in generally and especially Christian funerals. What's the purpose of a funeral? Why have humans since their earliest days had rituals concerning the dead? How are Christian funerals different, and how are they done well? How have Christian funerals shaped us and our ministries? We hope you enjoy the discussion. For the free-for-all, we discuss our best and worst quick fixes, as a result of an unfortunate run-in Wade had with a toilet that assaulted him. Also, Jason takes his first stab at an intro. Feel free to rate him/judge him. 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	6:00 - Free for All (Corner Kicks We'd Never Take; We're Sorry)
 	15:45 - Main Topic (The Divine Service as Law and Gospel)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY-TWO, Wade, Mike, Jason, and our guest, Abigail, discuss the divine service as a proclamation of law and gospel. Warning: We need to stop letting Wade come up with free-for-all topics on the spot, without running them by us. We apologize in advance for the discussion and we promise that none of us would ever hurt a fly, let alone anything else. 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You  can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

items.content:
In the FIFTY-FIFTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade, Mike, and Jason discuss Henry VIII and his interactions with Luther, as well as why England didn't go Lutheran. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

items.title: Wingin’ It 170.2: The Life of Luther (Part 55) – Henry VIII

items.content:
In the FIFTY-FOURTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade, Mike, and Jason discuss the Münster rebellion, a takeover of the city by Anabaptists eager to establish a new Jerusalem here on earth. Needless to say, it didn't end well. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

 	“Not Drunk” by The Joy Drops is licensed under an Attribution 4.0 International License.
 	Image: "Portrait of Luther" by Lucas Cranach the Elder is in the Public Domain.

items.title: Episode 168: Mark 10

items.content:
In the FIFTY-THIRD session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade, Mike, and Jason discuss the 1530s, giving a survey of the decade before we dive deeper into individual events, works, and people again. Wade is oddly silent, which some people may or may not enjoy. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

Thanks for listening!

items.title: Wingin’ It 167.3: The Life of Luther (Part 52) – John Frederick

items.content:
In the FIFTY-FIRST session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade, Mike, and Jason discuss the Luther and the Divine Call, having read his treatise, Infiltrating and Clandestine Preachers, written regarding Anabaptist preachers disturbing parishes.  We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

items.title: Wingin’ It 167.2: The Life of Luther (Part 51) – Luther and the Divine Call

items.content:

items.title: Episode 167: Mike Wrote Some Theses, A LOT of Them

items.content:
In the FORTY-NINTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Jason discuss George Spalatin, a man who was Luther's friend, Frederick the Wise's privy secretary and chaplain, John Frederick's tutor, an advisor to future electors, a pastor in Altenburg, and a whole lot more. Name an important Lutheran Reformation event and there's a good chance Spalatin was either there or working behind the scenes. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

items.title: What You Really Need a Pastor for and the Pastor's Study

items.content:
In the FORTY-EIGHTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade, Mike, and their new colleague, Jason Oakland, discuss Torgau, Luther's Warning, and the question of resistance, namely, could the elector or other princes resist the emperor if the emperor tried to invade their territories because of their confession of the faith. We are sorry, but we did not get to discuss Jasondale much. Maybe next time. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

You can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

items.title: Pastoral Potpourri

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	9:45 - Free for All (What Would You Give an Arm for?)
 	19:50 - Main Topic (How Our Views on Preaching Have Changed since Seminary)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND SIXTY-FOUR Wade and Mike, and Pastor John Bortulin, discuss how our views on/approaches to preaching have changed since seminary and some other pastoral stuff. This is the third in a "backyard series" with Pastor Bortulin. We hope you will enjoy it.

items.title: How Our Views on Preaching Have Changed since Seminary

items.content:
In the FORTY-SEVENTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade, Mike, and their new colleague, Jason Oakland, discuss confessions and the Lutheran Confessions. We also discuss Jasondale, which is sure to come up more in the future. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

items.title: Readers, Texts, and Context

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	4:45 - Free for All (Who Do You Fear More, Government or Corporations?)
 	17:45 - Main Topic (Celebrity in the Church)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND SIXTY-TWO Wade and Mike, and Pastor John Bortulin (!), and Ben and Peter(!) discuss the temptation of celebrity in the church and the danger that comes with it. We stayed focused, sort of. It was definitely fun to have the gang back together. This is the first in a "backyard series" with Pastor Bortulin. We hope you will enjoy it.  


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.content:
In the FORTY-FOURTH session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike discuss Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor during Luther's life, and beyond. This session has some scandal, but not as much as the previous one. This time Wade and Mike have some fun with it, but not too much. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion nevertheless.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:


 	

 	

 	 iTunes
 	Stitcher
 	Google Play
 	TuneIn Radio
 	iHeartRadio





You can also like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. You can also follow our Telegram Channel, where we post our new episodes as well as other content that we think you might enjoy. And, of course, share us with a friend or two!
If you’d like to contact us we can be reached at podcast@LetTheBirdFly.com, or visit our website at www.LetTheBirdFly.com.
Thanks for listening!

Attributions for Music and Image used in this Episode:

 	

 	"Slow Burn" by Kevin MacLeod is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License.
 	“Not Drunk” by The Joy Drops is licensed under an Attribution 4.0 International License.
 	Image: "Portrait of Luther" by Lucas Cranach the Elder is in the Public Domain.

items.content:
In the FORTY-THIRD session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike discuss Philip of Hesse, an important ruler during Luther's life and one who helped shape the path of the Reformation in Germany. This session has scandal! Yes, scandal! Unfortunately, Wade and Mike perhaps have a little too much fun with it. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion nevertheless.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.
And as always, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY-THREE Wade and Mike team up again, and are joined by a special guest, Dr. Kenneth Cherney from Wisconsin Lutheran Seminary, where he teaches courses in Old Testament and Systematic Theology and serves as editor of the Wisconsin Lutheran Quarterly. We thank Dr. Cherney for having us and we hope you enjoy our discussion regarding texts, culture, interpretation, and other fun stuff. 


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

In the FORTY-SECOND session of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike discuss the Marburg Colloquy, a crucial event for the development of the Swiss and Lutheran Reformations. At the outset, though, they get a little distracted and talk Wall Street Bets and hedge funds 🚀🚀🚀🦍🦍🦍. Sorry. Sometimes certain things are just too much fun not to talk about them. We hope that you will enjoy this discussion.

items.content:
In the THIRTY-SEVENTH episode of our Wingin' It series on the Life of Luther, Wade and Mike discuss the first Diet of Speyer. Although not as famous as some of the other diets of this time, Speyer had a lasting impact. We hope that you will enjoy this brief survey of the Diet of Speyer and its legacy.

Let the Bird Fly! is supported by the 1517 Podcast Network, which is part of 1517.org. If you haven't done so yet, stop over there and check out the other great podcasts in the network, as well as all of the other excellent content they offer.

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	7:32 - Main Topic (Why America Is Losing Its Mind: We've Forgotten History, or Never Learned It)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY-SIX Wade and Mike team up...again...after their first time recording in a long time last episode. This is the second episode in what might become a ten or eleven episode series, supposing Wade shows up again, entitled "Why America Is Losing Its Mind." The guys explore why history matters and the problems that arise when we forget it, or if we never really learned it. We hope you will enjoy it.


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org. 
If you're enjoying the show, please subscribe, rate, and review us on the following sites and apps:

items.title: Why America Is Losing Its Mind: We've Forgotten History, or Never Learned It

WORK_OF_ART: Why America Is Losing Its Mind

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	12:46 - Main Topic (Why America Is Losing Its Mind: We're Not Liberal, and We Should Be)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY-FIVE Wade and Mike team up again for the first time in a long time. This is the first episode in what might become a series, supposing Wade shows up again, entitled "Why America Is Losing Its Mind." Basically Wade put together an eleven point rant and Mike decided to go along because he is just happy Wade decided to participate in the podcast again. The first episode of this series, which may or may not actually be a series because who knows how Wade will feel tomorrow, is subtitled "We're not Liberal, and We Should Be." The guys explore what it means to actually be liberal as opposed to being illiberal (not liberal vs. conservative). We hope you will enjoy it.


 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

WORK_OF_ART: Why America Is Losing Its Mind

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	03:05 - Free-for-All (Defunct stadiums you wish you could visit)
 	12:07 - Main Topic (On Being Single and Christian)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY-FOUR Mike welcomes Rev. Dr. Phil Huebner (Dr. Phil) from Wisconsin Lutheran High School onto the podcast to talk about singleness and Christianity. Has the church ignored single people or taken them for granted? The two, yes married, professors talk about how the church has viewed singleness and how the church can minister to, use, and appreciate single Christians. We hope you will enjoy!

 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 144: On Being Single and Christian

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
06:53 - Free-for-All (What would you change if you could go back?)
19:27 - Main Topic (Brewing and the Reformation)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY-THREE Mike welcomes pastor and award winning brewer, Rev. Jeremy Glowicki of St. Paul’s Lutheran in Jordan, MN, to talk about home brewing, Martin Luther, Katie Luther, and the Reformation. The two pastors open with a free-for-all on things they would change if they could go back to beginning of their ministries before sitting back on a beautiful fall day with Glowicki’s “Luther Brew” to discuss beer and Reformation history. 

 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.

items.title: Episode 143: Brewing and the Reformation

items.content:
00:00 - Introduction
 	02:37 - Free-for-All (Last Meals)
 	09:45 - Main Topic (Preaching on Social Issues)

In episode ONE HUNDRED AND FORTY-TWO Wade and Mike discuss the difficulty of preaching the law and on social issues in particular. How can a preacher maintain the prominence of the gospel and still speak about sanctification? How can a preacher leave the listener with the precious gospel and still speak about the world in which the Christian lives? We hope you will enjoy this discussion on how to preach on social issues.

 We are grateful to the 1517 podcasting network. If you haven't done so yet, make sure to go check out all of the great podcasts they have to offer, as well as the other wonderful content at 1517.org.
